intro: Spergula fimbriata subvar. glabrifolia, commonly known as the smooth-leaved mouse-ear, is a flowering plant in the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped, smooth leaves that are typically less than 2 cm in length. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to parts of Europe and is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides. This subspecies is adapted to well-drained soils and is generally hardy in temperate climates.
